title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.2% To 102.99
items.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.2% to 102.99 — snapping a three-trading-day winning streak.

items.title: Nazi Ties to Credit Suisse Ran Deeper Than Was Known, Hidden Files Reveal
items.description: Fresh look at archives unearthed Nazi-linked accounts discovered by bank in 1990s but never disclosed to investigators.

items.title: Don’t compare your retirement investments to the S&P 500
items.description: Retirement is about maximizing reliable cash flow for life

items.title: One Man's Attempt to Get a Perfect 850 Credit Score
items.description: The grade of financial health, once a figure tucked away on loan applications, has become an everyday obsession for more Americans.

items.title: ‘He ended up homeless and penniless’: My uncle conned my father into signing over their mother’s house. What can I do?
items.description: “His brother went to the prison where my dad was incarcerated and had him sign over the house.”

items.title: 100% stocks for retirement? A new study says dump the 60/40 portfolio and target-date funds.
items.description: An all-equity portfolio, with a focus on international stocks, could be the key to maximizing retirement wealth, research suggests.

items.title: ‘He’s 70 and fairly wealthy’: I met the love of my life three years ago. How do I politely ask that he include me in his will?
items.description: “His two sons are against any kind of commitment between us, as their dad has had two failed marriages.”

items.title: The Secret to Staying on Budget: Set Aside Money for Splurging
items.description: I keep a tight rein on my spending throughout the year. But for my birthday, I focus on what I want, not just what I need.

items.title: Retail Is Fashionable With Investors Again, But Only the Unflashy Kind
items.description: More people than ever are running errands at their neighborhood shopping center. Supply of this type of property is surprisingly scarce.

items.title: The real-estate holdings of 5 of the world’s richest men
items.description: These men have amassed an incredible array of real estate holdings, spending some of their enormous fortunes on swanky homes across the U.S.—and beyon...
